metadata.Title: CVE-2022-44032 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 6.0.6. drivers/char/pcmcia/cm4000_cs.c has a race condition and resultant use-after-free if a physically proximate attacker removes a PCMCIA device while calling open(), aka a race condition between cmm_open() and cm4000_detach().

notes.Note: sbeattie> "fixed" in upstream by removing all of the pcmcia char drivers in 9b12f050c76f ("char: pcmcia: remove all the drivers") [v6.4] cascardo> requires physically proximate access to systems with PCMCIA sbeattie> similar to CVE-2022-44033

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty/esm is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needs-triage').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needs-triage').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needs-triage').
linux-signed package in trusty/esm is affected and may need fixing.
linux-signed-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needs-triage').
linux-signed-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needs-triage').
